elements.title: Mike Brunson
elements.contents: ... that former NFL player Mike Brunson (pictured) was known for making banana ice cream?

elements.title: There's a Hole in the City
elements.contents: ... that "There's a Hole in the City" is a Nebula Award–nominated short story that describes the September 11 attacks alongside the "summoned ghosts from past disasters" in New York City?

elements.title: André Kieffer
elements.contents: ... that French businessman André Kieffer was described as a "one-man party" and "easily the most aggressive and controversial figure" in the territorial assembly of Chad?

elements.title: Girardinus metallicus
elements.contents: ... that only black Girardinus metallicus males put on a courtship show, while yellow and colorless males rely on coercion?

elements.title: Hermann E. Sieger
elements.contents: ... that Hermann E. Sieger, a Nazi Party official, was considered to be a trusted contact of the Liechtenstein government?

elements.title: the murder of a gay man in Afghanistan
elements.contents: ... that the murder of a gay man in Afghanistan forced his brother to flee to Turkey and his boyfriend to go into hiding due to harassment from the Taliban?

elements.title: Group Architects
elements.contents: ... that the Group Architects led strikes against traditional teaching styles at the Auckland School of Architecture in 1948, which were attended by 142 of 160 students?

elements.title: GameChat
elements.contents: ... that GameChat was inspired by Nintendo developers' frustrations over video-conferencing software during the COVID-19 pandemic?

elements.title: Sukumar Barua
elements.contents: ... that Sukumar Barua chose to work as a chef instead of pursuing poetry as a career because his pay was too good?
